intro: Urvillea andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's urvillea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Urvillea andersonii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and subtropical regions.
